title: How to Know if Someone Blocked You on YouTube: Quick Tips

steps.title: Go to the channel that you think blocked you.
steps.content: Go to the channel that you think blocked you. A channel URL usually looks like youtube.com/@[channelname].

steps.title: Leave a comment on one of the channel's videos.
steps.content: Leave a comment on one of the channel's videos. Click a video from the channel's page, and then type a comment into the field below the video. If you're on mobile, tap the comments section first, and then tap Add a comment' .

steps.title: Open a private window in your browser.
steps.content: Open a private window in your browser. To go incognito , click ⋮ or ☰ to open the settings menu. Click New Incognito Window or New Private Window . If you're using the mobile app, you can use YouTube in a mobile browser (logged out). If you're already using a mobile browser, you can find your private window settings near your new tab options. If you don't want to use a private window, you can sign out of YouTube instead.

steps.title: Navigate to the same video.
steps.content: Navigate to the same video. You can search for the same video again, or you can copy and paste the URL from the previous window into the private window. If you're using the mobile app, you can copy the link to your clipboard by tapping Share at the bottom of the video and selecting Copy link .

steps.title: Try to find your comment.
steps.content: Try to find your comment. If it isn't already sorted from newest to oldest, select Sort by underneath the video and click Newest first . On mobile, tap the comments section. Then, tap Newest . If your comment is not listed on their channel, the channel has likely blocked you or turned off new comments.

steps.title: YouTube allows creators to "hide" other users.
steps.content: YouTube allows creators to "hide" other users. Currently, there's no block feature that fully stops another person from following or interacting with another channel. Similarly, there is no feature that blocks a specific channel from appearing on a user's feed. When someone chooses to hide a user from their channel, this means that all previous comments left on the channel's video will be hidden within 48 hours. This essentially means the user is shadowbanned, and all interactions with the channel and videos won't be visible. Hidden users also cannot create clips from your videos or live streams. [1] X Research source If you're hidden by a channel user, you can still do everything normally, such as watch videos and subscribe, but all of your interactions will be hidden until the channel user chooses to "show" you again.

steps.title: YouTube does not notify hidden users.
steps.content: YouTube does not notify hidden users. When you hide someone on YouTube, it happens discreetly. The only way for the hidden user to check is to manually search for their previous comments while using incognito mode (or logged out).

steps.title: Log into YouTube.
steps.content: Log into YouTube. You can use the mobile app or desktop website. Use this method to "hide" a user from your channel. This prevents their comments from being seen by others watching your videos.

steps.title: Navigate to a comment the user left.
steps.content: Navigate to a comment the user left. You should see options next to the comment.

steps.title: Select ⋮.
steps.content: Select ⋮ . This will open a pop-up menu.

steps.title: Select Hide user from channel.
steps.content: Select Hide user from channel . The user will be hidden. All comments posted by the user will be hidden within 48 hours.

steps.title: Unblock a YouTube user (optional).
steps.content: Unblock a YouTube user (optional). If you decide you want to "show" the user again, you can unhide them. Keep in mind that previously hidden comments will remain hidden, and any new comments will show up. Do the following: Sign into YouTube Studio . Select Settings . Select Community . Find the user in the Hidden users section. Select Remove next to the user. Select Save .
